summary: Robocalls and other unwanted calls consistently rank among the top consumer complaints to FCC and FTC. Robocallers often use a fake caller ID—a practice known as “spoofing”—to disguise their identities and gain credibility. Spoofing schemes have deceived people into providing financial information or buying falsely advertised products, costing them millions of dollars each year. We looked at what federal agencies are doing to protect consumers...
title: Fake Caller ID Schemes: Information on Federal Agencies' Efforts to Enforce Laws, Educate the Public, and Support Technical Initiatives
